IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE LEGAL REPRESENTATION TO LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS AND VICTIMS OF DOMESTIIC VIOLENCE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE QUALITY LEGAL REPRESENTATION TO LOW-INCOME RESIDENTS AND VICTIMS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE IN BUCKS, CHESTER, DELAWARE, AND MONTGOMERY COUNTIES. LASP ALSO WORKS TO EMPOWER INDIVIDUALS TO SOLVE PROBLEMS WITHOUT THE NEED FOR REPRESENTATION THROUGH LEGAL EDUCATION AND INCREASED ACCESS TO THE COURTS, AND TO CHANGE COMMUNITY PRACTICES AND SYSTEMS THAT CAUSE OR AGGRAVATE POVERTY.
IRS990.Desc: LASP PROVIDES FREE, CIVIL LEGAL SERVICES TO LOW INCOME AND VULNERABLE PEOPLE LIVING IN BUCKS, CHESTER, DELAWARE AND MONTGOMERY COUNTIES. DURING THE 2017-18 FISCAL YEAR, LASP ADVOCATES HANDLED 8,776 CASES THAT IMPACTED THE LIVES OF MORE THAN 18,000 PEOPLE. LASP RESOLVES LEGAL PROBLEMS THAT THREATEN CLIENTS' ACCESS TO THE BASIC NECESSITIES OF LIFE, INCLUDING SHELTER, HEALTH CARE, INCOME, PERSONAL SAFETY AND FAMILY STABILITY. LASP CLIENTS INCLUDE LOW WAGE WORKERS, OLDER ADULTS, DOMESTIC ABUSE VICTIMS, PEOPLE LIVING WITH DISABILITIES AND VETERANS.LEGAL SERVICES ARE PROVIDED THROUGH 7 COMMUNITY OFFICES, A TOLL-FREE REGIONAL LEGAL HELPLINE AND OUTREACH SITES IN EACH COUNTY. A STANDARDIZED INTAKE PROTOCOL ENSURES THAT ALL CLIENTS MEET ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA DETERMINED BY LASP'S GOVERNMENT FUNDING SOURCES AND THAT THEIR LEGAL PROBLEMS ARE ONES THAT LASP IS ABLE TO ADDRESS. LASP ADVOCATES PROVIDE THREE LEVELS OF SERVICE - LEGAL ADVICE; BRIEF, TIME-LIMITED SERVICES; AND EXTENDED REPRESENTATION. EXTENDED REPRESENTATION INCLUDES TASKS SUCH AS LEGAL RESEARCH, DRAFTING AND FILING LEGAL DOCUMENTS, NEGOTIATING ON A CLIENT'S BEHALF AND REPRESENTING A CLIENT IN COURT OR AT AN ADMINISTRATIVE HEARING. LASP HANDLES CONSUMER, FAMILY, AND HOUSING LAW PROBLEMS; APPEALS WHEN GOVERNMENT BENEFITS ARE DENIED, REDUCED OR ENDED; EXPUNGING/SEALING MINOR CRIMINAL RECORDS TO REMOVE BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT AND OTHER LEGAL PROBLEMS. A VERY ACTIVE GROUP OF PRO BONO ATTORNEY VOLUNTEERS INCREASES THE NUMBER OF PEOPLE LASP CAN HELP.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: LEGAL AID OF SOUTHEASTERN PENNSYLVANIA INC

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CLIENT DEPOSITS ARE HELD IN ESCROW BY LEGAL AID OF SOUTHEASTERN PENNSYLVANIA TO COVER COURT RELATED COSTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS JOHN MCKENNA AND WILLIAM GALLAGHER HAVE A BUSINESS RELATIONSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS SUBMITTED TO THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR HOLDS ANNUAL MEETINGS WITH KEY EMPLOYEES TO REVIEW THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR MONITORS ONGOING TRANSACTIONS FOR CONFLICT OF INTEREST VIOLATIONS THROUGH NORMAL REVIEW OF MONTHLY PURCHASES AND INVOICE PAYMENTS. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PROVIDES OVERSIGHT AND GIVES FEEDBACK TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR FOR POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST ISSUES DETERMINED WHEN APPROVING PURCHASES AND INVOICES THAT REQUIRE THEIR SIGNATURE. THE KEY EMPLOYEES COVERED BY THE POLICY ARE THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, MANAGING ATTORNEY, AND FISCAL PERSONNEL. THE LEVEL OF DETERMINATION THAT A CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS MADE AND REVIEWED IS AT THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S AND BOARD OF DIRECTORS' LEVELS. THE ORGANIZATION USES THE PERSONNEL POLICIES FOR DISCIPLINARY ACTION AND TERMINATION AS A GUIDELINE FOR PERSONS WITH A CONFLICT. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. ANNUALLY, THE REPORT IS GIVEN TO EACH BOARD MEMBER TO COMPLETE AND FORWARD TO THE PROGRAM.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR HAS RECEIVED THE SAME PERCENTAGE INCREASE AS THE REMAINING STAFF OF THE ORGANIZATION. COMPARABLE SALARY INFORMATION HAS BEEN PROVIDE TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
